attributes.action: Reduce vat on head lice treatment
attributes.background: Since the demise of the "nit nurse" in schools in the 1990's and the withdrawal of free NHS prescription for treatment's in 2018. Head lice are becoming more prevalent. Parents need some support, reducing expences would mean more parents could afford to treat successfully
attributes.additional_details:
Schools offer no advice or support to parents.

Doctors no longer prescribe on the NHS

Head Lice can cause stress  anxiety,loss of sleep and bullying. 

It is an unpleasant infection.

attributes.action: Make light reflectors mandatory for childrens prams & strollers
attributes.background: The law regarding light reflectors on prams/strollers in the U.K needs to change. Prams/strollers are currently not required by law to have any reflector of any kind, with priority given to style & the safely of the actual pram.
attributes.additional_details:
The pram will always be in front of the adult when being pushed. Crossing the road can be a hazard that cars may not see - with special consideration to darker prams, when a crossing is not available & along country roads.
 
Having reflectors will enable vehicle drivers to see the hazard a few crucial seconds before they would have without the reflectors.

attributes.action: Ban plastic bags
attributes.background:
The solution:
A law was introduced in October 2015 to have a 5p charge on plastic bags and are now planning to raise the charge to 10p in January 2020. This law has failed to significantly reduce waste. So what is the simple solution to all of this? Ban plastic bags all together by January 2020.
attributes.additional_details:
The issue:
Once we are finished with our plastic bags, we throw them in the bin ready for them to be taken to landfill. When they reach landfill, birds often mistake shredded plastic bags for food filling their stomachs with toxic debris. When a plastic bag reaches the ocean turtles cannot tell the difference between a jellyfish or a plastic bag. 91% of plastic waste isn’t recycled, meaning that the majority Virtually every piece of plastic that was ever made still exists in some shape or form.

attributes.action: Get paid for clean electricity exported to the grid
attributes.background:
Government plans to end payments for clean electricity exported from new small-scale systems from March 2019.

They propose that people give free electricity to their energy suppliers. This is unfair and will cause a huge drop in the number of installations, placing the UK solar industry at risk.
attributes.additional_details:
Two forms of payment to small-scale systems will be removed:

1. Feed in Tariff (on all electricity generated)
2. Export Tariff (on electricity sold back to the grid)

The first is a subsidy, but the second simply reflects a fair wholesale value for electricity sold to the grid.

Residential battery storage is not an economically or environmentally efficient solution. It is better to use and store solar generation at a community scale. This requires a fair price for exported clean energy.

attributes.action: Stop whilst in hospital exorbitant TV, phone and internet charges
attributes.background: We want the government to address the exorbitant prices that are taxed on ill people whilst in hospital, it is unacceptable for ill and terminally ill patient paying unrealistic charges for these services and then lining the pockets of companies based outside the UK

attributes.action: Parliament should not agree to the UK being part of an EU defence force
attributes.background: President of the Commission said that the EU is moving to having a single defence force. To avoid UK forces being committed to such a military force under EU law, Brexit agreement should contain clear legal drafting that excludes any such possibility

attributes.action: Let's get Thornton back on track - Reinstatement of the rail link.
attributes.background: The rail link from Poulton Le Fylde to Fleetwood via Thornton closed to to passengers in 1970 and to freight in 1999. The effect on our transport infrastructure and on jobs has been devastating.
attributes.additional_details:
Why do we want this?
1. To better connect Thornton Cleveleys to Poulton and Fleetwood (via rail and / or tram)
2. To battle the traffic congestion on our roads
3. To bring greater employment opportunities and economic prosperity to the area

attributes.action: Yemen: Call for ceasefire and support 6-point pledge to end conflict and famine
attributes.background:
With 85k children perished so far and 8m people on verge of starvation, the UK must act to protect the people of Yemen.
The government must call for a ceasefire, the adoption of a new UN Security Council resolution, proper funding of humanitarian relief, and investigation of alleged war crimes.
attributes.additional_details:
The six point pledge was drawn up by NGOs, politicians and members of the UN.

http://blog.handicap-international.org/influenceandethics/2018/11/12/alert-35-organizations-call-for-immediate-cessation-of-hostilities-in-yemen/

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/nov/22/famine-yemen-war-crime-civilians-saudi-coalition

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/yemen-war-latest-news-starving-save-the-children-yemeni-famine-a8643906.html

attributes.action: Ban the Sale of Puppies and Kittens in Pet Shops in the UK.
attributes.background: It can be hard to resist cute puppies and kittens for sale in pet-store windows. But a closer look into how these stores obtain animals reveals a system in which the high price that consumers pay for “that doggie in the window”.
attributes.additional_details:
It is a victory for the Lucy's Law campaign, which has been calling for the ban to be implemented.

The campaign was named after a Cavalier King Charles Spaniel who was badly treated in the puppy farming system.

attributes.action: Remove bylaw that means boat owners get prosecuted and fined as well as skippers
attributes.background: The IFCA’s that patrol and enforce out  to 6 mile waters have introduced a new bylaw that means if a skipper is prosecuted for an offence that the owners of the boat automatically get convicted and fined if the skipper is found guilty. This is an injustice to the boat owners.
attributes.additional_details: This is just a money making exercise for them and not in the best interest of the fishing industry. We need to stop this now

attributes.action: Publicly reject Action on Sugar's call for a "milkshake ban"
attributes.background:
Action on Sugar, a British pressure group, has called for all milkshakes with more than 300 calories to be banned for health reasons. 

This is absurd, and would be a huge government overreach. Large, thick milkshakes are a tasty occasional treat, and virtually everyone treats them as such.
attributes.additional_details:
Action on Sugar is basing their wild demand for a ban based on the ridiculous assumption that these kinds of milkshakes would be "consumed on a daily basis", to quote their own chairman Graham McGregor.

The government should publicly state that they are not seriously considering this proposal. The obesity crisis is serious, but this is not the solution.

BBC report: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-46179175?SThisFB&fbclid=IwAR2_MwWYdlQU4p8SeoADkSdm40-8ajWkqgkqdzXQTKH0iXH0tz0U2qpM3a0

attributes.action: Stop UK Government foreign aid to India
attributes.background: UK’s global aid commitment is in the countries national interest, but when £330 million is squandered on a giant bronze statue in India it must be seriously evaluated whether that money could not better be spent at home.

attributes.action: Ban Saturday school in all private schools to make the systems fair
attributes.background: Many private schools have Saturday school and many others don’t. Saturday school is a huge effort and much more money for parents to spend on their education. As a student you need rest and Saturday school does not allow this.

attributes.action: Raise the barriers that run along the Dartford Bridge to reduce suicides
attributes.background: There have been many people who have taken their lives on the Dartford Bridge in the past few years and these cases are still rising. This could be reduced and prevented in most cases by the installation of a raised  and curved barrier along the edges of the bridge to prevent people from climbing.
attributes.additional_details: With the installation of this barrier it is hoped that this will stop suicide attempts from the bridge. The cost of this could be easily covered by the Dart Charge and this cost will be much less than the lives of vulnerable people and their families. It has been proven to half attempts made on a bridge in Bristol. Samaritans signs have also been used which could be beneficial on the DB alongside CCTV. This will save lives and needs to be brought to the attention of local authorities and Government.

attributes.action: Require distinct Mental Health emergency departments within pre existing A&E’s
attributes.background: Mental health among British citizens is a rising concern.  Standard Accident and Emergency departments are not suitable for patients experiencing a psychiatric crisis.  Busy, loud waiting rooms are discouraging to attending psychiatric patients and the facilities pose risks as well as unsettlement.
attributes.additional_details: Psychiatric patients who aren’t in a critical or unstable physical situation would benefit from alternative waiting room set ups and resus style departments.  Basic safety precautions should be put in place for furniture & bathroom designs.  Provision of RMNs on duty to interact with patients whilst they wait.  Side rooms available for highly distressed individuals & for those having to wait several hours to be seen.  Access to sensory & distraction items to ease anxiety/agitation.

attributes.action: Change the law so the driver not the owner is responsible for a PCN
attributes.background:
My local council wrongly ticketed my company vehicle 
My company paid this fine and because the fine was paid the council closed the matter making impossible to appeal the ticket 
But my company then took this money from my wages leaving me out of pocket
attributes.additional_details:
On a non endorseable ticket it’s the owner not the driver that is liable 
However if you drive a company car your employer will more than likely pay the fine as ultimately they Will just deduct the money from this from your wages

attributes.action: Better treatment, education and career possibilities for UK sea faring cadets
attributes.background: Cadets for the most part are taken on for the tax breaks afforded to the companies and as such see no career prospects with their training provider, wages are unliveable on and education should be tailored more towards the role of a sea farer.

attributes.action: Pass a new law on access to evidence so the wrongly convicted can get justice
attributes.background: Too often, police and prosecutors are failing to disclose crucial evidence, which means that innocent people end up in prison while the guilty walk free.
attributes.additional_details:
Yet under the current law, it is almost impossible for innocent prisoners to win back their freedom by accessing evidence wrongly withheld from them.
 
Disclosure failings are the biggest cause of miscarriages of justice. A former CPS head said potentially thousands of innocent people are languishing in our prisons due to failures to hand over evidence to the defence.
 
To ensure justice for wrongly convicted victims of disclosure failings, Parliament should pass a new law giving convicted defendants the right to access all non-sensitive material held by the police and CPS on their case and to instruct special counsel to inspect sensitive files.

attributes.action: The government should grant £61,000,000 to children’s charities.
attributes.background: Children in Need do fantastic work across the UK. The Government should match the funding made by public donation to double the money available to children’s charities.
attributes.additional_details: £61,000,000 is available this year and, additionally, further funds can be allocated via Gift Aid.

attributes.action: Ask government to force car manufactures to must include spare wheel in all cars
attributes.background: Not having a spare wheel causes , unnecessary waste of time,obstructions, gives stress and force motorists to join a recovery service.

attributes.action: Give public vote on brexit either to accept the deal or leave with a no deal
attributes.background: We have voted to leave in a fair and democratic vote, we now need to vote on whether we agree with the governments deal to leave the EU or do we want to leave with a no deal

attributes.action: Name one of Her Majesties warships HMS Walker
attributes.background: Captain Walker was a superb Captain in WW2 in anti submarine warfare and died aged 48 in 1944. He was a highly decorated officer who died from exhaustion and overwork in 1944, his son was killed onboard HMSubmarine Parthian in 1943.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederic_John_Walker

Walker sank more U-boats during the Battle of the Atlantic than any other British or Allied commander, and he was instrumental in the Allied victory of the Battle of the Atlantic.

attributes.action: Stop "Public Duty Cost Allowance" ex Prime ministers get £115,000 every year.
attributes.background:
Ex Prime ministers should not be getting an extra 5-6 times the national average wage! The public do not know how this money is being spent. 

Ex Prime Ministers spent £538,067 between them in 2016-17.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/tony-blair-one-million-taxpayer-claim-public-duty-cost-allowance-prime-minister-cabinet-office-a8616731.html
 
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/647027/page_87_public_duty_cost_allowance.csv/preview
 
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/nick-clegg-claims-annual-expenses-allowance-deputy-prime-minister-liberal-democrats-public-duty-cost-a8158781.html

attributes.action: Change the law regarding organ donation so no consent required from next of kin
attributes.background: Last year my husband died. He was on the organ donor list yet they still required my consent as his next of kin to allow the donation procedure to be done. If i had declined consent they wouldn't be allowed to take his organs even though he himself had consented whilst alive. I find this very wrong
attributes.additional_details: The law currently requires that all  people on the organ donor register must have the permission of the next of kin after their death before the procedure can take place.I find this ridiculous. If you have made a choice whilst you are alive to donate your organs in the event of your death then how can it be that someone else, namely your next of kin,  can go against your wishes after your death.  This makes your choices whilst alive pretty pointless and meaningless and takes away your last wish

attributes.action: Ensure all schools offer reception children a full time education from September
attributes.background: Every September many schools accept reception children for only part of a day for up to 6 weeks, causing enormous difficulties for many parents. Working parents have to take leave, unpaid leave in the case of self-employed parents, or pay huge childcare costs while the phased start is in place
attributes.additional_details:
There is little awareness of a ruling by the Schools Adjudicator in 2013 who said, in reference to phased starts, “It is not permissible in my view for a school to deny a child a term of full-time education. The school has a duty to provide a full-time place from September and cannot refuse to do so.”

The latest school admissions code supports this, stating that a local authority must make clear that children are entitled to a full-time place in the Sept following their fourth birthday.

attributes.action: Make Bonfire Night a National Holiday
attributes.background:
Between August bank holiday and Christmas there are no national holidays in the UK. This leaves millions of people with nothing to look forward to for months on end and has led to the overhyping of Christmas. 
We need another holiday to look forward to. We DESERVE another day of celebration.
attributes.additional_details:
I propose we make Bonfire Night a national holiday. The Americans and Canadians have Thanksgiving but it doesn't seem right to copy this. 
Instead let's make the quintessentially British Bonfire Night a national holiday. 
Communities can come together and make/share food. Kids doing 'penny for the guy'. We need this. 
Let's make it happen!

attributes.action: Make it law that savings interest rates go up same time as loans & mortgages.
attributes.background: This last decade's rock-bottom interest rates cost savers at least £100 billion in interest, because banks are quick to raise rates on loans & mortgages after BoE hikes, but are reluctant to offer the same, timely hikes for savings. Savers see this as immoral an highway robbery on our High Streets.
attributes.additional_details:
Before the 2008 crisis, from 1998 to 2007, savers earned £233 billion in interest. Following it, from 2008 to 2017, they earned just £129 billion because banks fail to pass on rate rises announced by the BoE.
Interest rates cost savers at least £100 billion in interest payments https://dailym.ai/2ot5PJ3 
Millions of savers are being hit by rip-off rates https://dailym.ai/2PzyEin
 
We request that our MP's debate this in Parliament and create a new law that will enforce timely equitable treatment for interest rates on savings and retrospectively make good the deficit.

attributes.action: Parliament debate on the Right of Reply of people attacked in daily newspapers
attributes.background: It is intolerable and unfair that individuals attacked and criticised in the daily newspapers in the UK are not presently afforded the Right of Reply in said newspapers.
attributes.additional_details: I feel it is deemed necessary to debate whether individuals attacked in the UK mass media should be afforded an automatic Right of Reply to respond and the editors of the relevant newspapers should be made by law to publish those individuals replies with space afforded equal to the column size of the original articles which attacked them.

attributes.action: Save lives! Ensure ONLY Gas Safe engineers can buy & install gas boilers.
attributes.background: Stop unsafe installation of gas boilers by ensuring only qualified & registered Gas Safe engineers can buy/install gas boilers. Too few manufacturers have taken responsible measures to ensure only registered engineers can purchase their boilers. More manufacturers must follow suit!
attributes.additional_details: Many people all over the UK are put at serious risk when boilers are installed by rogue installers who claim to be qualified. They are able to get away with these practises as there are no checks & balances in place to ensure they cannot purchase boilers let alone fit them. If such regulation existed it will mean all installations would be traceable to a registered person & installed according to the highest level of safety expected of all Gas Safe registered engineers.

attributes.action: Change The Word Disabled to Enabled on Government publications.
attributes.background: In the past few decades those with physical, mental and illness have been called offensive, and dis-empowering names, focused on limitations and weakness. It is time to Stop Disabling us. Enable Us.
attributes.additional_details: Word's have power. Labelling and Disabling individuals you take away their power to be who they are, forcing them to prove and live in their challenges, focused on what they can not do. It also opens the system for fraud. Whatever the needs of a person to disable them prevents them from the support they need to fulfil their purpose, writing them off as DISABLED. A simple change with the word Enabled changes the way people are supported, and brings a can do attitude, and system that supports.

attributes.action: Immediate Brexit referendum needing 66% majority (4 options and 1st/2nd choice)
attributes.background:
4 Options: (A) Th. May’s deal (B) Renegotiate with the EU (if the EU declines -> Hard Brexit) (C) Hard Brexit (D) Remain

People vote 1st and 2nd choice
If 1st choice >66% majority - DONE. 
If not, least popular option is removed and 2nd choice taken into account >66% - DONE
and so on
attributes.additional_details:
Immediate as we have had 2yrs of "campaign" no need for more
Invalid responses:
“This is not what the electorate voted when they voted to leave”. The IN/OUT vote did not allow OUT voters to explain their limits. It is a disgrace to hijack the outcome suggesting to understand every OUT voter
“We must respect the will of the people and the democratic process which delivered this result”. (1) the will of the people is not static (2) the political class has failed to in any way create consensus

attributes.action: Return old armed forces/emergency services pensions for those who signed for it.
attributes.background: All armed forces and emergency services personnel had their pensions reduced in 2015. I joined the armed forces and have lost many family while away thinking I knew what I’d get on retirement. The goal posts have been changed, I feel those sacrifices have been in vain. Re-instate original pensions.

attributes.action: Support Finance Bill Amendment to stop no-deal Brexit without Commons approval.
attributes.background: A cross-party group of MPs has tabled an amendment to the finance bill designed to stop the UK leaving the EU without a deal. The amendment would require: a Brexit deal; an extension of article 50; or a commons vote specifically approving a no deal Brexit - thus preventing no-deal without approval.
attributes.additional_details: Further information can be found:  https://www.theguardian.com/politics/live/2018/dec/20/brexit-latest-theresa-may-andrea-leadsom-makes-case-for-managed-no-deal-politics-live?page=with:block-5c1ba91de4b0cebe76178870#block-5c1ba91de4b0cebe76178870

attributes.action: Dissolve
attributes.background:
Dissolution is the official term for the end of a Parliament. 25 days after a successful motion to dissolve a general election must be held.
Members of parliament in all parties fear the result of a general election too much to table the motion so we, the people, must demand it to see it happen.
attributes.additional_details:
"On a motion to dissolve the Parliament then in existence dissolves at the beginning of the 25th working day before the polling day for the next parliamentary general election as determined under section 1 or appointed under section 2(7)" Fixed-term Parliament Act of 2011.
The Government does not resign when Parliament is dissolved. Government ministers remain in charge of their departments but may not after the result of the election is known and a new administration is formed.

attributes.action: Ban the import and sale of badger hair in the UK.
attributes.background: Badger hair is often used in Britain because of certain water-retaining properties it has; however, the evidence is that animals suffer, at best, appalling living conditions, and at worst, terrible abuse and neglect, in order to produce this hair.
attributes.additional_details: Badger farms, predominantly in Asia, have been filmed keeping badgers in horrific conditions in order to produce hair for items like shaving brushes and paint brushes. When other options, like horse-hair, and artificial hair, is freely available, there is no reason to support this cruel industry in any way whatsoever, and the UK should take a lead in banning the use of this commodity.

attributes.action: Ban the use of single use plastic inside of cereal boxes
attributes.background: Most cereal comes packaged in plastic. The single use plastic bags not only are disposable and have a negative impact of our environment, but are unnecessary. Paper bags or no bags at all should be enough as the box contains all the contents.
attributes.additional_details: By stopping the use of plastic packaging inside cereal boxes, it will save the companies money, help reduce the pollution in our oceans and environment, and lower the amount of trash individuals and families produce. Alternatively, paper bags could be recycled and remade into more bags, creating a closed loop recycling system.

attributes.action: Military personnel should not pay any UK taxes when abroad or on bonuses
attributes.background: Military personnel pay taxes on bonuses they receive for staying in service and any extra money they receive when leaving their loved ones behind to go and serve abroad, yet they get taxed when not even in the country so I want to abolish this and have them only pay when in the country.
attributes.additional_details: People in the military should not have to pay UK taxes or national insurance when abroad or be taxed on any bonus payments they receive such as the commitment bonus for staying in military service or receiving extra money when being sent away from home as they aren’t even in the country at that time So why should they pay towards it especially since they deploy for months at a time where they don’t get to see family or friends and it isn’t pleasant when they do go away.

attributes.action: Repeal the Fixed-term Parliaments Act 2011
attributes.background: The Act was meant to prevent a hung Parliament after the 2010 general election. It has outlived its usefulness and in the current political situation in the country prevents the electorate from exercising their democratic will.

attributes.action: Reduce maximum stake Fixed Odds Betting Terminals from £100 to £2 by April 2019
attributes.background:
Chancellor Philip Hammond said in Monday's Budget that the in stakes from £100 to £2 would come into force in October 2019 not the agreed April 2019, this is totally unacceptable

The users of these machines are being sacrificed over Gambling Industry Profits.
attributes.additional_details:
"From the time of the announcement to reduce stakes and its implementation, over £1.6bn will be lost on these machines”

"In addition, two people will tragically take their lives every day due to gambling-related problems and, for that reason as much as any other, I believe this delay is unjustifiable." - Tracey Couch

Problem gamblers are often troubled, vulnerable and in self-destruct mode. An addict desires to burn quickly - the 'crack-cocaine' FOBT machines facilitate this B2 gaming/roulette can take £100 in seconds.

Please sign this petition to reduce the misery and risk of losing a loved one

attributes.action: Legalise the possession & use of Psilocybin Mushrooms for adults aged 18+.
attributes.background: Psilocybin mushrooms should not be classified as a Class A illegal drug alongside substances like heroin or cocaine. Studies suggest they are non-addictive, have incredible therapeutic value & have no long-term negative side effects.
attributes.additional_details: Psilocybin mushrooms have had documented use by mankind all over the world for hundreds if not thousands of years. They continue to be used today in religious or spiritual ceremony, as medicine or in recreational settings. Their classification as a Class A illegal substance in the UK is ludicrous, myopic and unjust. Consenting adults should be free to use these safe & naturally occurring, native or non-native fungi either as part of a spiritual practice, medicinally or in recreational settings.

attributes.action: Allow income tax relief for home owners.
attributes.background: Currently landlords obtain Income Tax Relief on residential property financing costs.   As far as I am aware this is not available for a mortgage on somebody's home.   Please give home owners a similar type of income tax relief on their home.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/restricting-finance-cost-relief-for-individual-landlords/restricting-finance-cost-relief-for-individual-landlords

attributes.action: Make it a requirement that airlines provide carbon emissions information
attributes.background: When travelling by air, it can be difficult to comprehend the environmental impact of your actions. Airlines are well placed to provide information on this, and doing so would empower consumers to make better informed decisions about how they fly.
attributes.additional_details: This information could be provided as part of the booking process.

attributes.action: Should be a pets NHS. Not every1 can afford their pets ops and treatments
attributes.background: If you can't afford your pets operations or treatments they end up getting put down and its not fair. If your from a working class family it can be hard providing for your family as well as paying huge vet bills. Pets are part of the family!:)xxx
attributes.additional_details: please sign

attributes.action: Require sanctions for breaches of the Ministerial Code
attributes.background: Ministers breaking the ministerial code result in a report describing the breach - action may not be taken. The code should be given some force e.g. minor technical breach - an apology to Parliament: Deliberate major breach - a lifetime ban on being a Minister.
attributes.additional_details: In cases where it is found there has been a deliberate major breach, the individual, and any other who behaved similarly, could not be relied upon to abide by the code in future and would therefore be unfit to be a Minister. A right of appeal to a court should exist in the event of such a sanction.

attributes.action: Offer free paediatric and adult first aid courses
attributes.background: Currently, first aid courses can prove quite expensive. When faced with someone in need, many don't have the confidence or knowledge to give first aid. Free courses can provide everyone with the skills and mentality, and allow them to be able to assist with first aid when needed.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 5 people will be faced with someone who needs immediate cpr throughout their lives, yet only 39% say they are able to perform cpr. Every minute that passes increases mortality. By offering these courses It allows those who may not have the confidence, knowledge or funding to be able to intervene in situations where lives are at risk, and hopefully, make a difference.

attributes.action: Fund NHS continuing care for all older people.
attributes.background: Some older people are only entitled to 6 weeks free care and then they are made to pay. Care should be free for all older people.

attributes.action: Ban escort review websites like UK Punting
attributes.background: On certain online escort review discussion boards, such as UK Punting, users submit aggressive & potentially defamatory posts about women. These websites ask for reviews to contain a link, contact details or address of the escort, which can put them at risk.
attributes.additional_details: The posts may contain unfounded accusations and fake reviews. Pictures of the escorts can be posted without consent. Such sites are dangerous to ALL women, not just sex workers. Appearing on them can lead to women being harassed, outed and having their addresses made public, which could result in criminal damage and burglary. Users can even post pictures of women in the street and give derogatory accounts of what they would like to do to them in locked sections of these forums.

attributes.action: Make it unlawful for social/news outlets to host any material of any child abuse
attributes.background: Failing to censor this material on platforms that are at so many peoples’ fingertips normalises this behaviour and perpetuates child abuse. Social and news medias have a responsibility to protect the vulnerable. These platforms must stop putting revenue before child safety by reporting and censoring
attributes.additional_details: Recent channel 4 Dispatches found that Facebook's moderators were not removing child physical abuse images from its platform, they merely place a warning on the images. Similarly, the mail online recently showed a graphic video of a mother beating her twins for profit. It is my belief that by leaving this kind of footage on media, whereby you needn’t seek it out, desensitises the public, normalises this behaviour and justifies mimicking. Any abuse of children should be taken as seriously as sex abuse

attributes.action: Pool pennies from cash transactions into government fund for ex-service people
attributes.background: The 1p and 2p coins are made at significant financial cost & environmental cost (energy & mining). 6 in 10 of 1p and 2p coins are only used once before being saved in a jar or discarded. In one in 12 of these cases, the coins are thrown in the bin. Its time to pool our pennies for ex-service people!
attributes.additional_details:
This is a petition to the UK Government to provide an option at point of sale for diverting 1p and 2p coins into a government fund that helps in vocational training before discharge as well as housing of ex-service people who never go on strike but are often left to fend for themselves after they have served the country unselfishly. Its a shame that 10% of the UK homeless population is made up of ex-soldiers!  

HM Treasury: Cash and digital payments in the new economy
https://owwsoldiers.co.uk/

attributes.action: Enforce LGV's to the inside lane on major dual carriageway routes at PEAK times.
attributes.background:
Such as the A38 Birmingham to Derby & the A50 from Nottingham to Stoke. It is clear from travelling on the A14 where this was trailed and later enforced that it works.
This SAVES LIVES, emergency services resources & reduces insurance renewals (from fewer RTC's).
